Key Match Events: Rhett Lowder issued back-to-back 2-out walks in the 3rd inning, loading the bases.
Kyle Hendricks dominated the Reds lineup, allowing just one hit and one run through five innings.
Tony Santillan and Buck Farmer took care of the Cubs offense for the next two innings.
Justin Wilson was brought in to face the lefties in the Cubs lineup despite his poor performance against left-handed hitters, allowing an inherited runner to score and two more runs.
Alexis Diaz got a force out at home and then an RBI single from Pete Crow-Armstrong, pushing the Cubs' lead to 2-0.
The Cubs picked up another run on a 4-pitch walk in the 8th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds are now in last place, tied with the Pittsburgh Pirates at 76-85 on the year.
There were only four total strikeouts in the game.
Rhett Lowder’s rookie season ends with a 1.17 ERA in six starts, not giving up a home run but with 14 walks and just 22 strikeouts.
The 85th loss of the year means that in eight of the last 10 full seasons the Reds have reached at least 85 losses.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds offense managed just three hits on the day.
The game was shortened by rain delays leading to a postponement until the next day.
Hunter Greene is scheduled to start for the Reds in the next game against the Cubs.
Others: The Reds are expected to aggressively pursue trading for Sonny Gray.
The Reds are eligible to get the 1st Pick on the draft since they got the 2nd in the draft lottery.
Hunter Greene, Rhett Lowder, and Stephanson are noted as bright spots for the Reds.
The team ops in 3 months was bottom 5 in the league.
The Reds showing a 0-4 record since Bell was fired, playing negligent at the offense, might be a kind of message to be understood.
The Reds’ bench has a historically bad BA and other offensive categories.
The team is considering external candidates for the managerial position.
Nick Krall is expected to be replaced, and the team is looking for external candidates for the managerial position.
